intro: Eucryphia glutinosa, commonly known as the sticky eucryphia, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, sticky resinous sap. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in coastal environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a valued species in New Zealand's native flora.
